results.title: Algiers
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Walter Wanger and John Cromwell
results.brief_description: A romantic Casbah thief (Charles Boyer) makes the mistake of falling in love. Hollywood romantic drama based closely on the French original, Pepe le Moko. laughed at for years because of the alleged line `Come with me to the Casbah’ (which was never actually said), it holds up remarkably well in its fashion. Rated: PG

results.title: Alfie
results.creator_credit: Sheldrake Films Ltd and Lewis Gilbert
results.brief_description: This wonderful comedy is the film that catapulted Michael Caine to stardom. Alfie (Caine) is not really a bad sort. He’s just a philandering cockney playboy who has this overwhelming desire for the opposite sex. What’s more, he likes to brag about his conquests, and he doesn’t have to exaggerate, because Alfie gets them all; fat, thin, blonde, brunette, young and even the older ‘richer’ woman. He’s just irresistible, no one can beat him at the mating game! This is Michael Caine at his chauvinistic best. Also stars Shelly Winters as Ruby. Based on the play by Bill Naughton.

results.title: Alexandra's project
results.creator_credit: Fandango Australia, Palace Films, South Australian Film Corporation, Julie Ryan, Domenico Procacci and Rolf De Heer
results.brief_description: What strange and sometimes nasty things go on behind closed doors in suburbia is what this feature, written and directed by Rolf de Heer, is all about. An emotionally spent housewife Alexandra (Helen Buday) organises a birthday surprise for her husband and father of her two children. After enduring years of financial and emotional shutdown at the hands of her husband (Gary Sweet), Alexandra seeks revenge and sets about to undo her husband to the level at which she feels she has been wronged. Set for the most part within the four walls of the family home “Alexandra’s Project” is a tense, sexual and unsettling drama. Nominated for five Australian Film Institute Awards and three IF Awards. Contains sex scenes.

results.title: Alexander Nevsky
results.creator_credit: Mosfilm, Sergei Eisenstein and D Vasiliev
results.brief_description: Sergei Eisenstein’s patriotic masterpiece of the exploits of 13th Century Russian hero Prince Alexander Nevsky was his first sound film and featured a special musical score by composer Sergey Prokovief. The Prince, as chosen leader of the people of Novgorod, vanquished the Teutonic Knights on the ice of Lake Peipus. The characters, boldly drawn and unencumbered with psychological details, are monumental figures. All are conceived as they are imagined today and as they survive in folklore. The impressive cast includes Nikolai Cherkassov as Nevsky.

results.title: Albino alligator
results.creator_credit: Motion Picture Corporation of America, Brad Krevoy, Steve Stabler, Brad Jenkel and Kevin Spacey
results.brief_description: Kevin Spacey makes his directorial debut with “Albino alligator”, a tense and claustrophobic thriller. A robbery goes wrong for three petty crims (Gary Sinise, Matt Dillon, William Fichtner), when a shootout results in the death of a federal agent. They flee to Dino’s Last Chance Bar, a New Orleans basement dive. Their attempt to lay low and maintain anonymity is abruptly shattered when government agents, camera crews and a SWAT team surround the building. The stalemate causes the crooks, patrons and bar employees to react to the situation in unexpected and dramatic ways, contributing to the films tense drama. Also starring Faye Dunaway, Skeet Ulrich, M. Emmet Walsh and Joe Mantegna.

results.title: Alamo Bay
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Louis Malle and Vincent Malle
results.brief_description: French director Louis Malle seems to have an extraordinary gift to capture the spirit and ethos of American society. As in his earlier “Atlantic City”, this film features a great cast of accomplished actors who are offered the opportunity to develop richly complex characters. A young Vietnamese refugee attempts to find work in a Texas fishing town. His arrival is the catalyst for ugly confrontations between European and Asian Americans. Though the business owners are only too happy to exploit the labour of the refugee community, this creates tension between the Vietnamese and American workers who feel that their livelihood is threatened by immigrant labour. The film unflinchingly potrays the ugliness of racism but it does not resort to reducing people or events to stereotypes. By focusing on the experiences of Asian-Americans, “Alamo Bay” shows how the racist underpinnings of white Southern society affect all human relationships in the country. The outstanding cast includes Ed Harris, Amy Madigan and newcomer Ho Nguyen. The evocative theme music is by Ry Cooder.

results.title: Akira Kurosawa's Dreams = Dreams
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Akira Kurosawa USA Productions, Hisao Kurosawa, Mike Y Inoue, Steven Spielberg and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: This Japanese-American co-production can be regarded as Kurosawa’s last personal philosophic and cinematic testament as he explores in eight vignettes the cost of war, the perils of nuclear warfare, and above all man’s need to harmonise with nature. It is Kurosawa’s belief that, ‘Man is genius when he dreams’, and his visions are here, superbly realised in Takao Sato and Masaharu Ueda’s sunny cinematography. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Martin Scorsese and Akire Terao.

results.title: Air Force One
results.creator_credit: Buena Vista International, Armyan Bernstein, Gail Katz, Jonathan Shestack and Wolfgang Petersen
results.brief_description: Cementing his status as action hero leading man, Harrison Ford plays the United States President who also happens to be a Vietnam War hero. Trapped aboard his private jet, President Marshall must display a steely reserve in the face of unhinged kidnappers. Peterson (In the Line of Fire, The Perfect Storm, Troy) ably directs this mainstream thriller that produces a tangle of twists but lacks the enormous tension generated by his classic wartime nail-biter “Das Boot”. Cast also includes Gary Oldman, Wendy Crewson, Paul Guilfoyle, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell, William H. Macy.

results.title: Aimee & Jaguar = Aimee and Jaguar
results.creator_credit: Senator Film Production, Hanno Huth, Gunter Rohrbach and Max Farberbock
results.brief_description: Based on the memoirs of Lilly Wust as recorded by Erica Fischer in her best-selling book, published in 1994, “Aimee and Jaguar” is a compelling love story that transgresses socially and politically imposed regulations around gender, race and culture. It tells the true story of two German women, one Jewish and one Aryan, who dared to fall deeply in love with each other at the height of the Holocaust. 1943- Lilly is a model bourgeois German mother of four children who indulges in affairs while husband is away fighting on the Eastern front. When she receives a love letter signed ‘Jaguar,’ she suspects a male admirer. But it is from the audacious Felice, a Jewish Resistance fighter, who initiates the passionate love affair that ignites between the two women amidst the bombing raids and anti-Semitic persecution. Inevitably it is a romance that is destined to end in tragedy. An immensely moving period drama, that also offers a visually impressive evocation of life in Berlin during WWII. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Aguirre: wrath of God
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog Filmproduktion and Werner Herzog
results.brief_description: A stunning and gruelling adventure about a band of Spanish conquistadors led by Aguirre, and their descent into the heart of darkness while exploring the Amazon in search of El Dorado, the legendary city of Gold. As the expedition moves further into the jungle, they leave reality behind and enter a dreamlike, otherwordly land of delusion and madness. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Cecilia Rivera, Ruy Guerra, Helena Rojo, Del Negro and Daniel Zacapa. In German with English subtitles.
